alert.note: Alert for Orleans; St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 02 at 12:53AM CST until December 02 at 4:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Orleans and St. Tammany and southern Mississippi, including the following counties, Hancock, Harrison and Pearl River. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1252 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen and some additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Slidell, Picayune, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Diamondhead, Pearl River, Stennis Space Center, Pearlington, Kiln, Shoreline Park, Lacombe and Slidell Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
